fields.value: Pre-Analysis Plan for Public Attitudes toward Asylum-Seekers and Asylum Policies across Europe

dsDescriptionValue.value: Summary: Does the willingness of European voters to welcome asylum-seekers in their municipalities vary as a function of the specific attributes of the claimants (e.g. country of origin, education, reason for fleeing)? And to what extent do voters' preferences over specific features of asylum policies vary across the different countries in Europe? To address these questions, we field a large-scale survey experiment among 15,000 voters in fifteen European countries. Based on these unique data, we assess the extent to which respondentsâ€™ social dispositions, partisan orientation and ideology correlates with attitudes towards asylum-seekers, and measure the impact of specific characteristics of asylum-seekers and asylum policies on public support.

files.description: Sweave code. The code will compile once the data are collected, but not before. Prior to data collection, though, the public nature of this code serves to commit the authors to an analysis plan before observing the data.
files.label: AsylumAnalysis.Rnw
